summary: The euro (â‚¬) is the money used in most of Europe, with 20 countries in the European Union using it. It's the second most important currency worldwide, after the US dollar. Introduced in 1999, it replaced the European Currency Unit (ECU). Physical euros were available in 2002, and they've been growing in value. The euro has been trading close to or above the dollar's value, reaching a high of $1.60 in 2008. Recently, due to global events, the euro and dollar have been at parity.
title: Euro
